answers.answer: The gastro. usually does liver biopsies to check for liver damage,or they may send you for a CTscan or a Sonogram. You can have liver problems even is you are a non drinker. He also does colonoscopies . Of course this is not something done in his office and must be scheduled. They also will check out your lymph nodes.I'd be concerned about the kidney stones. I have never had one but I understand they are quite painful. They may send you have them disolved buy using (some kind of ultrasount)Good Luck cat

question: I am a 35 year old female, non-drinker with type 2 diabetes. I just had a CT scan done and the results show a mass on my liver, swollen lymphnodes in my abdomen and multiple kidney stones.. My main worry is the lymphnodes and the mass on my liver.. What would / could be the cause? My Urologist is sending me to a Gastro. Specialist, what kind of testing should I expect outside of the normal blood work-up? I'm scared....
title: Mass found on liver
